description: Borrowed from Latin convincō (“I refute, prove”), from con- + vincō (“I conquer, vanquish”). Doublet of convict. Displaced native Old English oferreċċan.

verbs.description: convince (third-person singular simple present convinces, present participle convincing, simple past and past participle convinced)

entries.meaning: To make someone believe, or feel sure about something, especially by using logic, argument or evidence.
examples: I wouldn't have or do something, unless I'm convinced that it's good.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To confute; to prove wrong.
(obsolete, transitive) To prove guilty; to convict.
